Steps.Description: Send the Browser Back app command

Actions.Script:
// Send CTRL+SHIFT+Tab
sp.SendKeys("^+{TAB}");

Steps.Description: Send the Browser Forward app command
Centers the window on the screen. Demonstrates invoking an object method [action.Window.Center()]

Actions.Script:
// Center the window underneath the mouse cursor where the gesture started to the screen the program is on
action.Window.Center();

Steps.Description: Maximize or Restore the window, depending on its current state

Actions.Script:
// Minimize the window underneath the mouse cursor where the gesture started
action.Window.Minimize();

Steps.Description: Sends the Close command to the window.

Actions.Script:
// Send the close command to the window underneath the mouse cursor where the gesture started 
action.Window.SendClose();

// Send the CTRL+W key combination
sp.SendKeys("^w");

// Send CTRL+Tab
sp.SendKeys("^{TAB}");

// Send the CTRL+C keystroke
sp.SendKeys("^c");

// Send the CTRL+V keystroke
sp.SendKeys("^v");

// Send the Delete key
sp.SendKeys("{DELETE}");

// Send the Escape key
sp.SendKeys("{ESCAPE}");

Steps.Description: Open Explorer. Use RunProgram to provide more specific commands.

Actions.Script:
// Open the Windows File Explorer
sp.RunProgram(sp.ExpandEnvironmentVariables("%SystemRoot%")+"\\explorer.exe", "", "", "", false, false, false);

// Opens the main StrokesPlus.net Settings window
sp.OpenSettings();

// Send the CTRL+X keystroke
sp.SendKeys("^x");

Steps.Description: This will allow you to retain the expected functionality of holding the shift key and right clicking. Since this is an event that would be captured by S+, this action simply sends Shift+Right click directly. Assumes you're still holding Shift.

Actions.Description: Open file and add a line
Show selected files in File Explorer

Steps.Description: Toggle Mute on the default playback device
Sends the Win key down event, then the Tab key press, followed by releasing the Win key

Actions.Script:
// Clear the Windows clipboard
clip.Clear();

// Play or pause current playing media
sp.SendVKey(vk.MEDIA_PLAY_PAUSE);

Steps.Description: Send the Volume Up app command
Send the Volume Down app command
Sends the Next Track app command

Actions.Script:
//Play the next track in the current media player
sp.SendVKey(vk.MEDIA_NEXT_TRACK);

Steps.Description: Send the Previous Track app command

Actions.Script:
//Play the previous track in the current media player
sp.SendVKey(vk.MEDIA_PREV_TRACK);

// Send the CTRL+A keystroke
sp.SendKeys("^a");

BeforeAction.Script: //This script will run before the action itself runs

AfterAction.Script: //This script will run after the action itself runs

Actions.Script:
//Send the CTRL+Page Up keystroke
sp.SendKeys("^{PGUP}");

//Send the CTRL+Page Down keystroke 
sp.SendKeys("^{PGDN}");

BeforeAction.Script: //This script will run before the action itself runs

AfterAction.Script: //This script will run after the action itself runs

Actions.Script:
// Send CTRL+T keystroke
sp.SendKeys("^t");

// Send the CTRL+SHIFT+T keystroke
sp.SendKeys("^+t");

Steps.Description: Send the Browser Refresh app command

Actions.Script:
// Refreshes the current tab
sp.SendVKey(vk.BROWSER_REFRESH);
